translated: And by the command of Hari, that which belongs to others never becomes enjoyment for them anywhere.

original: anyagamaśubhaṃ tveṣāṃ devānāṃ kvacidapi bhogāya na bhavati /
analyzed: anya gam aśubham tu eṣām devānām kvacid api bhogāya na bhavati
translated: But the inauspicious belonging to others never becomes enjoyment for those gods anywhere.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why is that?

original: hareḥ prītito 'śubhe 'pyeṣāṃ svātantryādbhagavatprasādena maitadasmānprāpaditi nivāraṇe teṣāṃ sāmarthyasadbhāvāt /
analyzed: hareḥ śubhe pi eṣām svātantryāt bhagavat prasādena mā etat asmān prāpat iti nivāraṇe teṣām sāmarthya sadbhāvāt
translated: Even in the inauspicious, the inauspicious belonging to others is of them due to independence from the delight of Hari, because they have the power to prevent it by saying May this not come to us by the grace of the Lord.

original: maitadetānprāpaditi harerevājñayā ca /🔽anyagamiti vadatā svagataṃ tu bhavatīti sūcitam /🔽anenāsati nivāraṇakāraṇa iti svāmitvaheturviśeṣito bhavati /
analyzed: mā etat etān prāpat iti hareḥ eva ājñayā ca  anya gam iti vadatā svagatam tu bhavati iti sūcitam  anena asati nivāraṇa kāraṇe iti svāmi tva hetuḥ viśeṣitaḥ bhavati
translated: And by the very command of Hari, saying May this not come to them.🔽By saying that which belongs to others, it is indicated that what belongs to themselves does occur.🔽By this, the reason of ownership is specified as in the absence of the cause of prevention.

analyzed: yat uktam aviśeṣāt iti tat asiddham
translated: What was said as due to the absence of distinction is not established.

analyzed: vyavasthāpaka śruti sadbhāvāt iti āha puṇyam eva iti
translated: To this he says: 'Merit alone' etc.

analyzed: puṇyam eva amum āpānoti na devān pāpam āpnuyāt
translated: To show that there is a Vedic text that establishes this, he says: Merit alone follows him, he does not attain sin to the gods.

analyzed: ityādi śrutayaḥ māna mukte rthe
translated: These and other Vedic texts are the authority for the stated meaning.

original: anenapuṇyamevāmuṃ gacchati na ha vai devānpāpaṃ gacchati' /
analyzed: anenapuṇyam eva amum gacchati na ha vai devān pāpam gacchati
translated: By this, he quotes the Vedic text: Merit alone follows him, sin does not go to the gods.

analyzed: iti śrutim upādatte
translated: He accepts this Vedic text.

original: amuṃ saptānnavidyopāsanena prerakatayā parapurapraveśinaṃ parakṛtaṃ puṇyamevāpnoti na pāpam /
analyzed: amum saptānna vidyā upāsanena preraka tayā para pura praveśinam para kṛtam puṇyam eva āpnoti na pāpam
translated: By the meditation on the seven foods, he attains only the merit created by others, not the sin, of the one who enters the other's house as an instigator.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: devaḥ hi asau jātaḥ
translated: Because he is born as a god.

analyzed: na hi devān prāpnoti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he does not attain the gods.

analyzed: ukte rthe śubham eva bhavati na aśubham iti arthe
translated: In the stated meaning, the meaning is that it is auspicious, not inauspicious.

analyzed: vyavasthāpaka antaram āha yuktayaḥ iti  yuktayaḥ parāḥ
translated: He states another establishing factor, the reasons.🔽The other reasons are...

original: aparāḥ pūrvoktābhyām /🔽ukte 'rthe mānamiti sambandhaḥ /🔽kāstā yuktaya ityatastā darśayitumāgamavākyaṃ paṭhati upasaneti //
analyzed: aparāḥ pūrva uktābhyām  ukte rthe mānam iti sambandhaḥ  kāḥ tāḥ yuktayaḥ iti atas tāḥ darśayitum āgama vākyam paṭhati upasanā iti
translated: Other than the previously mentioned ones.🔽The connection is that they are the authority for the stated meaning.

analyzed: upāsanā dharma phalam yatas deha antare sthitiḥ
translated: What are those reasons? To show them, he quotes an authoritative statement: The fruit of the dharma of meditation is the attainment of another body,🔽and by the command of Vāsudeva, and in accordance with past actions...

analyzed: vāsudeva ājñayā ca eva pūrva karma anusārataḥ
translated: And by the command of Vāsudeva, and in accordance with his previous actions,🔽.🔽

original: prerayanti hi te jīvān puṇyapāpeṣu nityaśaḥ /
analyzed: prerayanti hi te jīvān puṇya pāpeṣu nityaśas
translated: For they constantly impel the souls to virtue and sin.

analyzed: arāga dveṣataḥ ca eva katham doṣān avāpnuyuḥ
translated: And being free from attachment and aversion, how can they incur sin?

analyzed: hari ājñā karaṇāt eva puṇyam ebhiḥ avāpyate
translated: Merit is obtained by them only through the performance of Hari's commands.

analyzed: hari pūjā iti ca uddeśāt katham na śubham āpnuyuḥ
translated: And since it is declared that they worship Hari, how can they not obtain what is auspicious?

analyzed: yatas kāraṇāt deha antare sthitiḥ
translated: Because of this, there is existence in another body.

analyzed: para puram praviśya tatra puṇya pāpa preraṇam
translated: Entering another's city, impelling virtue and sin there,

analyzed: devānām bhagavat upāsanā janita dharma phalam
translated: is the fruit of dharma generated from the worship of the Lord by the gods.

analyzed: atas katham pāpa ādikam doṣān avāpnuyuḥ
translated: Therefore, even while impelling sin etc., how can they incur sin?

analyzed: nahi sāttvikaḥ dharmaḥ duḥkha paryavasāyī
translated: For virtuous dharma does not end in suffering.

analyzed: tattva vyāghātāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is because of the contradiction of truth.

analyzed: para pure devānām pāpa ādi preraṇam na duḥkha hetuḥ
translated: Impelling sin etc. of the gods in another's city is not a cause of suffering.

analyzed: sāttvika dharma phala tvāt tattva jñāna vat iti uktam bhavati
translated: It is said that it is the fruit of virtuous dharma, like the knowledge of truth.

original: kiñca te devā vāsudevājñayaiva na tu svecchayā tattatkṛtapūrvakarmānusārata eva /
analyzed: kiñca te devāḥ vāsudeva ājñayā eva na tu sva icchayā tad tad kṛta pūrva karma anusārataḥ eva
translated: Moreover, those gods, by the command of Vāsudeva, not by their own will, act in accordance with their own past actions.

original: ata evārāgadveṣato rāgadveṣau vinaiva nityaśo jīvānpuṇyapāpeṣu prerayanti hi yasmāttasmātkathaṃ doṣānavāpnuyuḥ /
analyzed: atas eva a rāga dveṣataḥ rāga dveṣau vinā eva nityaśas jīvān puṇya pāpeṣu prerayanti hi yasmāt tasmāt katham doṣān avāpnuyuḥ
translated: For this very reason, without attachment and aversion, they always urge living beings to virtue and sin. Since this is so, how can they incur faults?

analyzed: prabhoḥ ājñayā aparādha anusāreṇa cora śāsaka rāja puruṣa vat iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that they are like the king's men who punish thieves in accordance with the king's orders and the offenders'.

original: pāpādipreraṇena devānāmaśubhaṃ na bhavatītyeva kevalaṃ na /
analyzed: pāpa ādi preraṇena devānām aśubham na bhavati iti eva kevalam na
translated: It is not only that the gods do not incur misfortune by urging sin etc.

analyzed: kintu hari ājñā anuṣṭhānāt jyotiṣyoma ādi anuṣṭhātṛbhiḥ iva ebhiḥ devaiḥ puṇyam eva āpyate
translated: But just as those who perform the Jyotiṣṭoma and Soma sacrifices obtain merit, so do these gods obtain merit by performing Hari's worship.

original: kiñca svavihitaparapreraṇe haripūjeyamiti coddeśātkathaṃ devā na śubhamāpanuyuḥ /
analyzed: kiñca sva vihita para preraṇe hari pūjā iyam iti ca uddeśāt katham devāḥ na śubham āpanuyuḥ
translated: Moreover, since it is stated that urging others to do what is enjoined by oneself is worship of Hari, how can the gods not obtain auspicious results?

analyzed: atas iti upasaṃhāraḥ
translated: Therefore is the conclusion.

analyzed: atas yathākramam dharma jñānayoḥ phalam añjasā
translated: Therefore, the fruits of dharma and knowledge are immediately obtained by the gods,

analyzed: sarva prāṇi gatam devāḥ prāpnuvantyāḥ viriñcataḥ
translated: from Brahmā onwards, in all living beings.

analyzed: dharma jñānayoḥ eva iti yojyam
translated: Dharma and knowledge alone should be connected.

analyzed: prāpnuvantaḥ pyā viriñcataḥ yathākramam prāpnuvanti iti apūrva uktiḥ na upasaṃhāraḥ
translated: Even though they obtain them, they obtain them from Brahmā onwards in due order. This is not a conclusion, but a statement of what is not known.

analyzed: anya gatam jñāna ādi phalam devāḥ prāpnuvanti
translated: The gods obtain the fruits of knowledge etc. in others.

original: devagataṃ tu kathamityapekṣāyāmuktam devā iti //🔽devā eva hi devānāṃ viśiṣṭā viniyāmakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: deva gatam tu katham iti apekṣāyām uktam devāḥ iti  devāḥ eva hi devānām viśiṣṭāḥ viniyāmakāḥ
translated: But how is it in the case of the gods? To answer this question it is said: The gods.🔽For the gods themselves are the superior controllers of the gods.

analyzed: devānām apakṛṣṭānām
translated: Of the inferior gods.

analyzed: atas tadīya jñāna ādi phalam teṣām bhavati iti śeṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, the result of their knowledge etc. belongs to them - this is the remainder.

analyzed: brahmā tu iti ā viriñcataḥ iti uktasya vivaraṇam
translated: Brahmā, however is an explanation of what was said up to Viriñci.

analyzed: brahmā tu akhila devānām narāṇām ca niyāmakaḥ
translated: Brahmā, however, is the controller of all gods and men.

analyzed: atas sarva guṇān eṣa prāpanoti adhikam anyatas
translated: Therefore, he attains all qualities more than others.

analyzed: deva ādi grahaṇam upalakṣaṇam
translated: The mention of gods etc. is by way of illustration.

analyzed: adhikam iti kriyāviśeṣaṇam
translated: More is a qualification of the action.

analyzed: bhavatu anya gata jñāna ādi phala prāptiḥ devānām
translated: Let there be the attainment of the result of knowledge etc. belonging to others by the gods.

original: tatrāpi tāratamye ko heturityata uktam dravyeti //
analyzed: tatra api tāratamye kaḥ hetuḥ iti atas uktam dravya iti
translated: Even there, what is the cause of the gradation? To this it is said: By substances etc.

analyzed: dravya svātantrya vijñāna prayatnaiḥ adhikam phalam
translated: The result is greater by substances, independence, knowledge and effort.

analyzed: devānām anya gam ca api teṣu yat brahmaṇaḥ dhikam
translated: And that belonging to others is also greater among them than that of Brahmā.

analyzed: bṛhat tantra uditam vākyam hariṇā phala nirṇaye
translated: The statement uttered by Hari in the Brihat Tantra is in the determination of the result.

original: dravyāṇīndriyādīni teṣu svātantryaṃ dravyasvātantryaṃ vijñānaprayatnau dharmādyutpānanimitte /
analyzed: dravyāṇi indriya ādīni teṣu svātantryam dravya svātantryam vijñāna prayatnau dharma ādi utpāna nimitte
translated: Substances are the senses and so on. Independence in them is the independence of substances. Knowledge and effort are the causes of the production of dharma etc.

analyzed: adhikaiḥ iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The rest is [to be supplied] with 'more'.

analyzed: caśabdaḥ nukta samuccaya arthaḥ
translated: The word 'ca' (and) is for the purpose of including what is not mentioned.

analyzed: madhyamaiḥ dravya svātantrya ādibhiḥ madhyamam

analyzed: alpaiḥ alpam iti
translated: The small [is obtained] by the small [means].

analyzed: teṣu api deveṣu niravadhika dravya svātantrya mat tvāt iti hi śabda arthaḥ
translated: Even among those gods, because of having unlimited independence of wealth, etc., this is the meaning of the word 'hi'.

analyzed: phala nirṇayaḥ iti tatra api prakaraṇa viśeṣa uktiḥ
translated: The determination of the result, even there, is the statement of a particular context.

analyzed: dravya svātantrya ādi atiśayāt phala atiśayaḥ iti uktasya vyāptim darśayati loke pi iti
translated: He shows the pervasion of what was said that the excess of result is due to the superiority of independence of wealth, etc., even in the world.

analyzed: loke pi etādṛśa guṇaiḥ phala ādhikyam hi dṛśyate
translated: In the world also, the excess of result is seen due to such qualities.

analyzed: etādṛśa guṇaiḥ iti adhikaiḥ dravya svātantrya ādibhiḥ samuditāyām kṛṣau
translated: Due to such qualities, it is said. Due to the combination of more independence of wealth, etc., in agriculture.

analyzed: yasya adhikam kṣetra ādi dravya svātantryam
translated: For one who has more independence of wealth, such as land, etc.,

original: yasya cā'vāpādau jñānaprayatnādhikyaṃ tasya phalādhikyaṃ dṛśyata ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: yasya ca āvāpa ādau jñāna prayatna ādhikyam tasya phala ādhikyam dṛśyate iti arthaḥ
translated: and for one who has more knowledge and effort in sowing and planting, the excess of result is seen. This is the meaning.

analyzed: evam madhya alpayoḥ api udāhatarvyam

analyzed: anena svātantrya tāratamyena iti uktam upapāditam bhavati
translated: By this, what was said as 'due to the gradation of independence' is explained.

analyzed: prasaṅgāt pāpa ādi phalam prerakāṇām asurāṇām tāratamyena bhavati iti āha evam ca iti
translated: By the way, it is said that the fruit of sin etc. of the instigators, the demons, is of varying degrees, thus:

analyzed: evam ca kali pūrvāṇām asurāṇām mahat phalam
translated: And thus, the great fruit of the demons headed by Kali,

analyzed: aśubheṣu sadā eva syāt mithyā jñāna ādikeṣu hi
translated: Would always be in the inauspicious, indeed in false knowledge etc.

analyzed: mahā prerakāṇām mahat ityādi iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that for the great instigators, it is great etc.

analyzed: aśubheṣu aśubha nimittam
translated: In the inauspicious, for the inauspicious.

analyzed: hi śabdena svātantryam hetum āha
translated: The word indeed states independence as the reason.

analyzed: evam iti deva dṛṣṭāntam
translated: Thus, the example of the gods.

analyzed: asurāṇām ca iti sambandhaḥ
translated: And the demons, thus is the connection.

analyzed: prāk ukte rthe ca pramāṇa antaram āha śubha iti
translated: And here, in the matter stated before, he states another proof, thus:

analyzed: śubha aśubha phalam devāḥ asurāḥ ca samāpnuyuḥ
translated: The gods and demons would obtain the fruit of good and bad,

original: krameṇaiva yathāśakti yathā ye ye prayojakāḥ // / / //
analyzed: krameṇa eva yathāśakti yathā ye ye prayojakāḥ
translated: According to their capacity and in order, as they are the instigators.

original: prerakā api pāpānāṃ na devāḥ pāpamāpnuyuḥ /
analyzed: prerakāḥ api pāpānām na devāḥ pāpam āpnuyuḥ
translated: The instigators of sins also would not obtain sin,

analyzed: iti prakāśikāyām hi provāca hariḥ añjasā
translated: Thus Hari clearly stated in the commentary.

analyzed: yathāsaṅkhayena śubha aśubha phalam  yathāśakti iti krameṇa evā iti atra yuktiḥ
translated: The fruit of good and bad according to their number.🔽According to their capacity means in order only. This is the reasoning.

original: tasya vivaraṇaṃ ye ye yathā prayojakāstathā tatheti /
analyzed: tasya vivaraṇam ye ye yathā prayojakāḥ tathā tathā iti
translated: Its explanation is as they are the instigators in such and such a way.

analyzed: prerakāḥ iti asya pūrvavat śaṅkā parihāraḥ ca
translated: The explanation of the word 'instigators' is as before, and the removal of doubts is also as before.

analyzed: om ārtvijyam iti auḍulomiḥ tasmai hi parikriyate om
translated: Om. Audulomi says it is the priest's duty, for he is engaged for that. Om.

original: oṃ sahakāryantaravidhiḥ pakṣeṇa tṛtīyaṃ tadvato vidhyādivat oṃ //
analyzed: om sahakāri antara vidhiḥ pakṣeṇa tṛtīyam tadvataḥ vidhi ādi vat
translated: Om. On one side, the injunction of another cooperating factor is the third, like the injunction etc. of one who possesses it. Om.

analyzed: evam prapañcena pūrvapakṣam uktvā siddhānta sūtra tātparyam āgama vākyena āha yadi api iti
translated: Having thus stated the prima facie view in detail, he states the purport of the Siddhānta Sūtra with an Āgama statement, beginning with Although...

original: ārtvijyam ity auḍulomiḥ tasmai hi parikrīyate / / / /
analyzed: ārtvijyam iti auḍulomiḥ tasmai hi parikrīyate  /
translated: Audulomi says it is the priest's duty, for he is engaged for that.

analyzed: sahakāri antara vidhiḥ pakṣeṇa tṛtīyam tadvataḥ vidhi ādi vat
translated: On one side, the injunction of another cooperating factor is the third, like the injunction etc. of one who possesses it.

original: yadyapyevaṃ surāṇāṃ ca daityānāṃ ca mahat phalam /
analyzed: yadi api evam surāṇām ca daityānām ca mahat phalam
translated: Although the great fruit of the gods and demons is thus,

analyzed: śubha aśubhebhyaḥ evam ca kartuḥ ca syāt yathā uditam
translated: And the doer's would be as stated from good and bad [actions].

original: evamuktaprakāreṇa yadyapi śubhāśubhebhyo jñānādibhyo bhavatphalaṃ surāṇāṃ ca daityānāṃ ca bhavatītyupapāditam /
analyzed: evam ukta prakāreṇa yadi api śubha aśubhebhyaḥ jñāna ādibhyaḥ bhavat phalam surāṇām ca daityānām ca bhavati iti upapāditam
translated: Although it has been established in this way that the fruit resulting from good and bad [actions] such as knowledge belongs to both the gods and demons,

analyzed: evam ca tathā api kartuḥ devadatta ādeḥ api phalam syāt eva
translated: in this way, nevertheless, the fruit would also belong to the doer, Devadatta and others.

analyzed: āgame pi asya arthasya prakṛta tvāt yadi api ityādi yujyate
translated: Even in the Āgama, this meaning being the subject matter, although etc. is appropriate.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is being said.

analyzed: deva asurāṇām śubha aśubha phalam iti etāvat abhyupagamyate pramita tvāt
translated: It is accepted that this much is known: the good and bad fruits of gods and demons.

analyzed: teṣām eva iti tu na kṣamyate
translated: But it is not accepted that they alone are the enjoyers.

analyzed: kintu kartuḥ api bhavati iti
translated: But it is said that the agent also is (an enjoyer).

original: kartuḥ phalāṅgīkāre yadu kiñcemāḥ prajā iti sāvadhāraṇaśrutivirodha ātreyavacanavirodhaśca syādityata uktam mahaditi //
analyzed: kartuḥ phala aṅgīkāre yat u kiñca imāḥ prajāḥ iti sāvadhāraṇa śruti virodhaḥ ātreya vacana virodhaḥ ca syāt iti atas uktam mahat iti
translated: If the fruit is accepted for the agent, there would be contradiction with the Vedic text that restricts it to these beings and with the statement of Atreya. To explain this, it is said: great (fruit).

analyzed: deva ādīnām mahat phalam kartuḥ tu alpam
translated: The great fruit is for gods etc., but the agent's is small.

analyzed: alpasya ca sattva vivakṣā bahulam upalabdhā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And it is the intention that the small one is often perceived.

original: kutaḥ kartuḥ phalāṅgīkāra ityata āha yathoditamita //
analyzed: kutas kartuḥ phala aṅgīkāraḥ iti atas āha
translated: From where is the acceptance of the fruit for the agent? Therefore it is said: as stated (in the scriptures).

analyzed: śruti smṛti sadbhāvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: because of the existence of Vedic texts and Smritis.

analyzed: tāḥ ca bhāṣya ādau udāhṛtāḥ draṣṭavyāḥ
translated: And those should be seen cited in the commentary etc.

analyzed: yuktam api āha tasmāt iti
translated: He also says what is proper: Therefore (the agent is the enjoyer).

analyzed: tasmāt niraya mānuṣya svarga mukti upabhoginaḥ
translated: Therefore, the enjoyers of hell, human, heavenly, and liberated fruits,

analyzed: mānuṣottamam ārabhya
translated: starting from the best of humans, etc., etc.

original: kartuḥ śubhāśubhaphalasadbhāvādeva mānuṣottamamārabhya devaparyantā daityaparyantāśca nirayādyupabhogina iti yujyate nānyathetyarthaḥ /
analyzed: kartuḥ śubha aśubha phala sadbhāvāt eva mānuṣottamam ārabhya deva paryantāḥ daitya paryantāḥ ca niraya ādi upabhoginaḥ iti yujyate na anyathā iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is proper that starting from the best of humans up to gods and demons, they are the enjoyers of hell etc., because of the existence of good and bad fruits for the agent, not otherwise.

analyzed: uktasya apavādam āha devāḥ tu iti
translated: He states an exception to what has been said: But the gods, except for hell...

analyzed: devāḥ tu nirayam vinā
translated: But the gods, except for hell...

analyzed: asurāḥ tu vinā muktim tamaḥ ndham api ca āpnuyuḥ
translated: The demons, except for liberation, would even attain blind darkness.

analyzed: iti tattva viveka uktam svayam bhagavatā vacaḥ
translated: This is the statement of the Blessed One himself, as stated in the Tattva-viveka...

analyzed: anya phala upabhoginaḥ
translated: Enjoyers of other fruits.

analyzed: na kevalam asurāṇām mukti abhāvaḥ ca āpnuyuḥ
translated: Not only is there no liberation for the demons, but they would even attain blind darkness.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati  manuṣya uttamāḥ tāvat niraya mānuṣya svarga muktīḥ prāpnuvanti  devāḥ ca mānuṣya svarga muktīḥ
translated: This is what is said.🔽The best of humans attain hell, human birth, heaven, and liberation.🔽And the gods attain human birth, heaven, and liberation.

analyzed: asurāḥ ca svarga mānuṣya niraya andhatamasāni
translated: And the demons attain heaven, human birth, hell, and blind darkness.

analyzed: na ca niraya ādīni nirnimittāni
translated: And hell and so on are not without a cause.

analyzed: na ca sva kṛta pāpa ādīni vinā nimittam asti
translated: And without a cause, one's own committed sins and so on do not exist.

analyzed: tasmāt kartuḥ api asti śubha aśubha phala prāptiḥ isita jñāyate
translated: Therefore, it is known that the agent also attains the fruits of good and bad actions.

analyzed: anyathā niraya ādi abhāva prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, the existence of hell and so on would be entailed.

analyzed: na ca vācyam sura asurāṇām kartṛ tva prayukta phala abhāve pi preraṇa nimitta phala sadbhāvāt mukti ādi upapattiḥ iti
translated: And it should not be said that liberation and so on are possible for the gods and demons because the fruits of instigation exist, even though the fruits employed by the agent are absent.

analyzed: devānām mānuṣya prāpteḥ ayogāt
translated: Because it is impossible for the gods to attain human birth.

analyzed: daityānām svarga ādi pāpteḥ anupapatteḥ
translated: Because it is impossible for demons to attain heaven and so on.

analyzed: sarvathā manuṣyāṇām niraya ādi prāpteḥ asambhavāt iti
translated: Because it is impossible for humans to attain hell and so on in any way.

analyzed: tat idam uktam mānuṣottamam ārabhya iti
translated: This is what is said: starting from the best among humans.

analyzed: manuṣya uttamānām ādi tva uktyā niraya ādi aneka phala uktyā ca
translated: By saying that humans are the best, and by saying that there are many fruits such as hell,

analyzed: vacaḥ sti iti śeṣaḥ
translated: there is a statement. This is the remainder.

analyzed: iti phala śruti adhikaraṇam
translated: Thus ends the section on the mention of fruits.
VI. Section on Non-Disclosure

analyzed: atha anāviṣkāra adhikaraṇam
translated: Now, the section on non-disclosure.

analyzed: om an āviṣkurvan anvayāt om
translated: Om. Not disclosing, because of the connection.

original: jñānadānaṃ kimāviṣkāreṇa kāryamutānāviṣkāreṇeti saṃśaye pūrvavadatrāpi pūrvapakṣamatyantaheyatvābhāvātprapañcenāṃha jñānadā apīti //
analyzed: jñāna dānam kim āviṣkāreṇa kāryam uta anāviṣkāreṇa iti saṃśaye pūrvavat atra api pūrvapakṣam atyanta heya tva abhāvāt prapañcena aṃha jñāna dāḥ api iti
translated: Should the gift of knowledge be given with disclosure or without disclosure? In doubt, like before, here also the prima facie view is elaborated because of the absence of utter undesirability.

analyzed: an āviṣkurvan anvayāt
translated: Not disclosing, because of the connection.

analyzed: jñāna dāḥ api ca ācāryāḥ viśeṣāt phalam āpnuyuḥ
translated: Even the teachers who give knowledge would attain the fruit, because of the difference.

original: na kevalaṃ śiṣyāḥ kintu jñānadā ācāryā api jñānaphalamāpnuyuḥ /
analyzed: na kevalam śiṣyāḥ kintu jñāna dāḥ ācāryāḥ api jñāna phalam āpnuyuḥ
translated: Not only the disciples, but also the teachers who give knowledge would attain the fruit of knowledge.

analyzed: tat ca viśeṣāt śiṣyāt api atiśayena
translated: And that, because of the difference, is even greater than that of the disciples.

original: ācāryā ityenenaiva siddhe jñānadā iti vacanaṃ jñānadāneneti jñāpanārtham /
analyzed: ācāryāḥ iti enena eva siddhe jñāna dāḥ iti vacanam jñāna dānena iti jñāpana artham
translated: Even by just saying teachers, the word who give knowledge is used to indicate that it is by giving knowledge.
The word 'ca' (and) includes the supreme teacher and others.

analyzed: kutas etat iti atas muktau iti
translated: From where does this come? Therefore, it is said in Mukti (liberation).

analyzed: muktau aṣṭaguṇam śiṣyāt guruḥ āpanoti śobhanam
translated: The teacher obtains eight times the good from the disciple in liberation.

analyzed: tad guruḥ dviguṇam tasmāt sārdham tāvat pare
translated: The teacher of that (teacher) obtains twice that, and the others half of that.

analyzed: devāḥ sahasra guṇitam kramāt tasmāt yathottaram
translated: The gods obtain a thousand times more, progressively more than that.

analyzed: brahmā mahā ogha guṇitam evam phala vinirṇayaḥ
translated: Brahma obtains it multiplied by a great flood. Thus is the determination of the fruit.

original: ityāha bhagavāñchāstre guruvṛttābhidhe svayam // / /d //🔽śiṣyāt śiṣyasya yacchravaṇaphalaṃ tato 'ṣyaguṇaṃ gururjñānadānenāpnoti /
analyzed: iti āha bhagavān śāstre guruvṛtta abhidhe svayam  śiṣyāt śiṣyasya yat śravaṇa phalam guruḥ jñāna dānena āpnoti
translated: Thus has the Lord himself said in the scripture called Guruvrata.🔽The teacher obtains a fruit that is even more excellent than the fruit of listening that the disciple obtains from the disciple.

analyzed: tat guruḥ guroḥ gurusmāt guru phalāt phalam āpnoti
translated: The teacher of that (teacher), the teacher of the teacher, obtains a fruit that is twice the fruit of the teacher.

analyzed: santāna kāraṇa tvāt
translated: Because he is the cause of the lineage.

original: tataḥ paramagurorapare guravaḥ svaśiṣyaphalāpekṣayā sārdhaṃ tāvat adhyardhaṃ phalamāpanuvanti /
analyzed: tatas parama guroḥ apare guravaḥ sva śiṣya phala apekṣayā sārdham tāvat adhyardham phalam āpanuvanti
translated: The other teachers after that, the supreme teacher, obtain a fruit that is half of the fruit of their own disciples, in relation to the fruit of the disciple.

analyzed: yathottaram tasmāt kramāt iti adhyardha prāpti kramāt deva ajñāna pravartaka tvāt sahasra guṇitam
translated: Progressively more than that, from that, in the order of obtaining half, the gods obtain a thousand times more, because they are the instigators of knowledge.

analyzed: yathottaram tasmāt kramāt iti brahmā mahā ogha guṇitam iti anena api sambaddhayate
translated: Therefore, in order, from that, in succession. This is also connected with multiplied by a great flood of Brahma.

analyzed: sahasra mahā ogha śabdau upalakṣaṇa arthau
translated: The words thousand and great flood are for the sake of illustration.

analyzed: paramparāyāḥ aniyata tvāt
translated: Because the succession is not fixed.

analyzed: āgama siddhe tra arthe yuktiḥ api asti iti āha yuktam ca tat iti
translated: As for this meaning established by scripture, there is also reasoning. He says And that is reasonable.

analyzed: yuktam ca tan
translated: And that is reasonable.

analyzed: pratigrahītuḥ śiṣyasya jñāna phalāt api ācāryasya jñāna dāna phalam adhikam iti etat yukti siddham ca
translated: It is reasonable that the teacher's fruit of giving knowledge is greater than the disciple's fruit of knowledge, who receives it. This is established by reasoning.

analyzed: tām yuktim sūcayati na iti
translated: He indicates that reasoning with No.

analyzed: na go dātā go mātra phalam āpnuyāt
translated: The giver of cows would not obtain the fruit of cows alone.

analyzed: pratigrahītuḥ hi go mātra phalam
translated: For the disciple who receives it has the fruit of cows alone.

analyzed: go dātā na go mātra phalavān bhavati
translated: The giver of cows does not become one who has the fruit of cows alone.

analyzed: kintu mahā phalam svarga ādikam ca prāpnoti
translated: But he obtains the great fruit and heaven, etc.

analyzed: yathā etat tathā prakṛte pi iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is just as this is.

analyzed: ayam atra prayogaḥ
translated: The argument here is as follows.

analyzed: jñāna dātā datta vastu phalāt api adhika dāna phalavān puruṣa artha hetu vastu dātṛ tvāt go dātṛ vat iti
translated: The giver of knowledge has a greater fruit of giving than the fruit of the thing given, because he is the giver of a thing that is the cause of human goals, like the giver of cows.

analyzed: jñāna phalāt api ācāryasya jñāna dāna phalam adhikām iti atra bhagavadgītā saṃvādam āha yaḥ imam iti
translated: To show that the fruit of giving knowledge to a disciple is greater than the fruit of knowledge itself, he quotes the Bhagavad Gita:

analyzed: yaḥ imam paramam guhyam mad bhakteṣu abhidhāsyati
translated: He who will proclaim this supreme secret to My devotees,

original: bhaktiṃ mayi parāṃ kṛtvā māmevaiṣyatyasaṃśayaḥ // / / //🔽na ca tasmānmanuṣyeṣu kaścinme priyakṛttamaḥ /
analyzed: bhaktim mayi parām kṛtvā mām eva eṣyati asaṃśayaḥ  na ca tasmāt manuṣyeṣu kaścid me priya kṛttamaḥ
translated: having fixed his devotion on Me, will certainly come to Me alone.🔽And among men there will be none dearer to Me than he.

original: bhavitā na ca me tasmādanyaḥ priyataro bhuvi /
analyzed: bhavitā na ca me tasmāt anyaḥ priyataraḥ bhuvi
translated: And there will be none dearer to Me on earth than he.

analyzed: iti āha bhagavān
translated: Thus has the Lord said.

analyzed: adhyeṣyate iti uttara vākyam atra paṭhanīyam
translated: The sentence will be taught should be read here.

original: yata evaṃ jñānadānaṃ tatsampradāyapravartanaṃ ca mahāphalam /
analyzed: yatas evam jñāna dānam tad sampradāya pravartanam ca mahā phalam
translated: Since thus the giving of knowledge and the propagation of its tradition are of great fruit,

original: ato bahūnāṃ grahaṇāyāviṣkāreṇa jñānadānaṃ kāryamiti prāpte siddhāntamāha evamapīti //
analyzed: atas bahūnām grahaṇāya āviṣkāreṇa jñāna dānam kāryam iti prāpte siddhāntam āha evam api iti
translated: it is concluded that the giving of knowledge should be done by revelation for the sake of many. To this, the conclusion is stated:

analyzed: evam api
translated: Even so,

analyzed: satyam jñāna dānam ukta prakāreṇa mahā phalam
translated: it is true that the giving of knowledge is of great fruit in the manner stated.

original: tathāpi nāviṣkāreṇa kāryaṃ kuta ityata āha pātramiti //
analyzed: tathā api na āviṣkāreṇa kāryam kutas iti atas āha pātram iti
translated: Nevertheless, it should not be done by revelation. Why? To this he says:

analyzed: pātram apekṣyate  dāna phalena iti śeṣaḥ
translated: A worthy recipient is required.🔽The meaning is: for the fruit of giving.

analyzed: pātre kriyamāṇam khalu dānam phalāya alam
translated: Indeed, giving done to a worthy recipient is sufficient for the fruit.

analyzed: na a pātre
translated: Not to an unworthy person.

analyzed: pratyuta pratyavāyasya eva hetuḥ
translated: On the contrary, it is the cause of a hindrance itself.

analyzed: āviṣkāreṇa jñāna dāne ca ayogyānām api tad prāptiḥ bhavati
translated: By revelation, the attainment of knowledge even to the unworthy occurs by the gift of knowledge.

analyzed: sā ca pratiṣiddhā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And that is prohibited, is the idea.

analyzed: iti anāviṣkāra adhikaraṇam
translated: Thus ends the section on non-revelation.
Now, in the section on worldly benefits and the fruits of liberation.

analyzed: atha aihika adhikaraṇa mukti phala adhikaraṇe
translated: Then, in the sections on worldly benefits and the fruits of liberation.

analyzed: om aihikam aprastuta pratibandhe tad darśanāt om
translated: Om. The worldly [benefits] are not the intended [purpose], in the absence of obstacles, because they are seen. Om.

analyzed: om evam mukti phala aniyamaḥ tad avasthā avadhṛteḥ tad avasthā avadhṛteḥ om
translated: Om. Thus, there is no restriction on the fruit of liberation, because it is determined by that state, because it is determined by that state. Om.

analyzed: adhikaraṇa dvayasya tātparyam saṅkṣepeṇa āha evam eva iti
translated: He states the essence of the two sections in brief, saying thus alone.

analyzed: aihikam api aprastuta pratibandhe tad darśanāt
translated: The worldly [benefits] are not the intended [purpose], in the absence of obstacles, because they are seen.

analyzed: evam mukti phala aniyamaḥ tad avasthā avadhṛteḥ tad avasthā avadhṛteḥ
translated: Thus, there is no restriction on the fruit of liberation, because it is determined by that state, because it is determined by that state.

analyzed: evam eva avirodhena prārabdhasya eva karmaṇaḥ
translated: Thus alone, without contradiction, the knowledge of the karma that is begun

analyzed: jñānam dṛṣṭa phalam proktam muktiḥ ca iha eva labhyate
translated: Is said to have visible fruits, and liberation is attained right here.

original: prārabdhasya karmaṇo 'virodhenaiva jñānaṃ dṛṣṭaphalaṃ proktamiti prathamādhikaraṇatātparyam /
analyzed: prārabdhasya karmaṇaḥ virodhena eva jñānam dṛṣṭa phalam proktam iti prathama adhikaraṇa tātparyam
translated: The purport of the first topic is that knowledge is said to have visible results only when it is not in conflict with the karma that has begun to bear fruit.

original: dṛṣṭaṃ ca tatphalaṃ ceti dṛṣṭaphalam śravaṇādisampūrtyanantarameva jñānamutpadyate /
analyzed: dṛṣṭam ca tat phalam ca iti dṛṣṭa phalam śravaṇa ādi sampūrti anantaram eva jñānam utpadyate
translated: And that result is visible, so it has visible results. Knowledge arises immediately after the completion of listening etc.

analyzed: yadi na asti
translated: If there is no obstruction to the karma that has begun to bear fruit.

analyzed: tasmin tu sati tad avasāne iti
translated: But when that exists, it ends with that.

analyzed: evam eva muktiḥ ca evā iha labhyate iti dvitīyasya
translated: Thus liberation is also obtained here, this is the purport of the second.

analyzed: yasmin dehe jñānam utpannam tad pāta anantaram eva muktiḥ labhyate prārabdha karma pratibandha abhāve
translated: Liberation is obtained immediately after the fall of the body in which knowledge has arisen, in the absence of obstruction by karma that has begun to bear fruit.

original: ndhakābhāve tadbhāve tu tadavasāna iti /🔽iti śrīmatpūrṇapramatibhagavatpādasukṛteranuvyākhyānasya praguṇajayatīrthākhyayatinā /
analyzed: ndhaka abhāve tad bhāve tu tad avasāne iti  iti śrīmat pūrṇapramati bhagavat pāda su kṛteḥ anuvyākhyānasya praguṇa jayatīrtha ākhya yatinā
translated: But when that obstruction exists, it ends with that.🔽Thus ends the third chapter in the commentary on the excellent commentary of the revered Pūrṇapratimābhagavatpāda, composed by the ascetic named Praguṇajayatīrtha,

analyzed: kṛtāyām ṭīkāyām viṣama pada vākya artha vivṛtau tṛtīya adhyāye smin carama caraṇaḥ paryavasitaḥ
translated: which elucidates the meanings of the difficult words and sentences in the commentary.

analyzed: iti śrīmat nyāyasudhāyām tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturthaḥ pādaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth chapter of the third chapter in the Naya-sudha.
